clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Histamine H1 Receptor Antagonist Clemastine in Cardiovascular Surgery With Cardiopulmonary Bypass: A Pilot Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

clinical_study.source: Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, Fuwai Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: In this study, a prospective, randomized, double-blind pilot trial designed to evaluate the effect of histamine H1 receptor antagonist clemastine on perioperative anaphylaxis in cardiovascular surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass, especially for the efficacy and safety on reducing heparin and protamine associated anaphylaxis.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, a prospective, randomized, double-blind pilot trial designed to evaluate the effect of histamine H1 receptor antagonist clemastine on perioperative anaphylaxis in cardiovascular surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass, especially for the efficacy and safety on reducing heparin and protamine associated anaphylaxis.

primary_outcome.description: Plasma histamine concentration evaluated by ELISA

secondary_outcome.description: Invasive blood pressure of radial artery: systolic, diastolic and mean pressure
Rate of skin manifestations, including wheal, papules, maculopapules, etc
Rate of perioperative arrhythmia, especially tachycardia
Rate of specific symptoms, including fatigue, sleepiness, dizziness, headache, stomach pain, constipation, nausea, dry mouth

intervention.description: Clemastine fumarate 2mg/2ml intramuscular injection is administrated into the gluteus maximus muscle
Saline solution 2ml intramuscular injection is administrated into the gluteus maximus muscle

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-75 years old
- Receiving selective cardiovascular surgery with cardiopulmonary bypass due to coronary, valvular or congenital heart disease
- Written informed consent obtained.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous history of cardiac surgery
- Allergy to clemastine, antihistamines with similar chemical structure or any excipient (sorbitol, sodium citrate, propylene glycol, ethanol)
- Myasthenia gravis
- Porphyria patients
- Bronchial asthma
- Usage of monoamine oxidase (MAO) inhibitors
- Pregnant or lactating women
- Mentally or legally disabled patients
